did.unittitle: Carlton Farmers’ Alliance No. 6 (Stevensville, Mont.) charter
did.abstract: This collection is an original charter from the National Farmers' Alliance authorizing the formation of the Carlton Farmers’ Alliance No.6, in Stevensville, Montana, on December 17, 1890.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The National Farmers’ Alliance was first organized in Texas in 1875. On May 20, 1886, the Montana Enterprise Farmers’ Alliance held its first organizational meeting. Meetings held included lectures on agriculture, and prizes were awarded for production.

On December 17, 1890, the Carlton Farmers’ Alliance No. 6 of Stevensville, Montana, was granted a charter. The Carlton Farmers’ Alliance had eighteen original members including president J.H. Powers and secretary August Post.

scopecontent.p: This collection is an original charter from the National Farmers' Alliance authorizing the formation of the Carlton Farmers’ Alliance No.6, in Stevensville, Montana, on December 17, 1890.
